lines.text:
[after Roy Black didn't showed up at a meeting with Brian Epstein cause of a date with his first love Nadine]
You let the manager of the Beatles down cause of some hippie-bitch. And you let you international music career flow, just like that. I think, you still don't understand
Why do I need Epstein? I'm the number one, his Beatles are the number two. There is nothing better then Number one. You said that, these are your words
Who do you think you are?
Me? I'm Roy Black, the one you earn your cash with.
Well, you may think, you're Roy Black but that provicial from Augsburg, he's just playing Roy Black. Boy, you have no idea, what you're doing, not at all. But maybe it's not your fault

[acting pilot Chris on the set of "Wenn du bei mir bist"]
Swear to me, that you will never leave me

[acting princess Tamani in the movie "Wenn du bei mir bist"]
I can't stay with you. My father has promised me to the prince Kurikan. I will forget you, Roy
Cut, goddamn. You should say "NEVER forget you" here. It's the 5th. tape. And by the way, Roy's name is Chris
'Du bist nicht allein' was very good. But our new song is fantastic. You'll like it very much. You'll see. Boys, play the music
[the band is playing the intro of "Ganz in Weiss"]

[interrupts]
That's such a slushy song again.

Listen to me carefully. We play, what the people want to hear. And right now they want this from you and from the Beatles they want something different, do you understand? You're a halfkid. You can do your rock'n roll again later in your life. Let's go.

[to his bandmates, after visiting Betrams recording studio first time]
He through, you can do with that provicial everything he wants. But he's wrong.

[seeing Roy Black and his band on the stage in Augsburg, talking about him]
The boys are incredible. You can forget all about the band. But the singer, he's driving the girls complete crazy.
'Schön ist es auf der Welt zu sein'
[it means 'It's nice to be in the world']
, since three weeks it's number one at our radio station and it IS nice, when so many women are at your feet and it IS nice, that he is here in our studio. Roy Black, hello and welcome
Thank you.
Is it true, that Germany's most desirable bachelor is going to marry?
No, it's not. I found out about my marriage plans from the newspaper.
It's just a rumour?
Yes, I don't have any marriage plans. I mean, first I need the right one.
That's a good advice. Dear future mothers-in-law, if you have a nice daughter, maybe yours is the right one for Roy Black.

[to Bertram, after Roy Black didn't appeared to a scheduled meeting, and it was time to go]
I thank you so much for your time, I really enjoyed talking to you. Thank you, thank you

[in the way home after a less successful concert]
So, come on, it was just the one time, next time the hall is full again and then...
...we are playing the same shit music again.
So, the shit music, it's my success, it's my life, it's me.
No, Gerd, it's not you. You know that very good, it's not you.
So, what am I?

[drunk after a failed concert on the way home]
Burda, can I ask you something, but really serious?
Yes.
What do you really think of me?
Really?
Yes, really.
You're an asshole.
How do you mean that?
You're an asshole, that's how I mean it.
But why?

[interrupts]
So why don't you jsut find another band? I don't put stones in your way.
Because I'm as same asshole as you are.
Gerd, I almost didn't recognized you with so noble clothes.
Well, I'm a a business trip.
I know. In real life you're complete different, aren't you.

[at the bar with his band after performing Twist and Shout, the audience is still cheering]
It's unbelieveble. I feel like I'm Elvis.
If Elvis would be an Augburg guy, he wouldn't have a chance against you.

[meets Bertram on the way home after a performance and a date]
I'm sorry, I completely forgot you.
Oh boy, I have to force you to your luck. I want to do a record with you and before it's not clear I don't go home.
Yes, I know, you produce Drafi Deutscher and Freddy Quinn but I have to talk with my bandmates about it.

There is nothing to talk about. Today's your lucky day. I smell it, that you have the stuff to become a great one. Records, television performances, I'm gonna make a star out of you. Or are you going to do music is these dives your entire life? So, here are 2 tickets and 200 marks and on tuesday, you're in Cologne in my studio. Any questions?

[coming on an empty press conference]
Where are they all?
It's all over.
What?
You understood correctly, it's all over and away.
''Germanys most popular bachelor gets married''. Isn't it anything?
It is over.
What does it mean now?
That means that you can do whatever you want. From now on, I'm not you manager
But why?
Why don't you ask Mr. Epstein?

[on the stage in from of a unfrequented concert]
Thank you. We don't missread the date, do we? Or are we in the wrong city? It's Cuxhafen, isn't it?
[audience cheers]
As my manager, you can be a little more relaxed, we're in the Showbizz, not in the tax office
In future, I won't come along to your performances any more. I think, it's better for both of us.

[in Bertrams record studio after reading the lyrics of "Du bist nicht allein"]
I don't want to sing this song
Now, wait a minute. What does it mean?
No. I'm a rock'n roller. And I also want to play with "The canons".
Didn't I gave you 300 marks?

[behind the scenes, watching Roy Black trying to perform ''Wahnsinn'']
He can't even sing with a playback. Is he drunk?
Rubbish!

[giving autographs after a birthday concert]
Did you like it?
To be honest, Herr Black, if I had organized this concert, at least you would have a dry towel now.

[the band interrupted playing "Paint it black"]
Why did you stopped? Come on, keep playing, keep playing.

Your records are not selling at all, the audience is empty and if others can do it, you can do it better. Gerd, you became multiple millionaire with that Schnulze-shit. You don't have to sing that stuff any more. And by the way, I know that you fed up of Roy Black. Surrender now, there is no other day later.

The important thing is, that you'Re coming up again. It's very important for all of us. Herr Black, the television invited you to a show "Schlager or the 60s and the 70s". They demand Roy Black! Roy, I always knew it. Not we're rising again. I knew it. Roy, it's going up again.
Well, it can't go down any more, right?

[It's christmas time and Roy is calling Silke in the middle of the night, Silke is awake now]
Hello?
Oh, hi there. It's me. Ehm, my buddies here and me...
Do you know what time it is?
So what? It's 3 o'clock. We wanted to wish you a merry christmas and I...
[Silke's hanging up]
Hello?

[Roy comes home from a trip, saying to his mother and brother Walter]
Guess what, they've played my song on the radio twice.
[hears ''Du bist nicht allein'' on the radio]
Thrice. It's unbelievable.
What do you mean "thrice"? They play it day and night, all the time. Even on the camping
This is our new hope, Roy Black.
Roy Black? How anybody can come up with that name=
In Augspurg everybody calls him "Blacky" cause of the hair and Roy is from his idol Roy Orbison.
I see. And what's his real name?
Roy Black.

[interrupting a record]
How dare you?
Sorry, I am not feeling well.

[showing Roy the newspaper headline about his meeting with Silke]
Do you want to destroy everything I built up? Have you forgotten that 98% of your fans are women?
Well, in my private life I can do whatever I want.
Private life? You have no private life! You don't belong to one woman, you belong to all women. And if you don't get that you can go back to Augsburg playing playboy of the village.

[Roy Black is in the hospital on the way to an operation and wants to put on his sunglasses]
This is not the time for looking like a star, Mr. Black
Please! I don't want to see all this.
